Description:
THIS GRANT WILL PROVIDE FUNDING TO THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA, DEPARTMENT OF ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENT (DC DOEE) FOR THE CONSTRUCTION OF FIVE CATEGORICALLY GREEN, NON-POINT SOURCE PROJECTS, AS IDENTIFIED IN THE GRANT APPLICATION DATED 6/22/2021, TO CONTROL STORM WATER RUNOFF AND PREVENT POLLUTION IN WATERWAYS:

RIVER SMART SCHOOLS - DESIGN AND CONSTRUCTION OF STORM WATER GREEN INFRASTRUCTURE (GI) AT THREE DC PUBLIC/CHARTER SCHOOLSAND  OXON RUN STREAM RESTORATION - PRODUCE 30% DESIGNS, COMPLETED ENVIRONMENTAL ASSESSMENT, MASTER PARK PLAN, AND  ASSESSMENT AND RECOMMENDATION FOR SEWER LINE REHAB, REPAIR, OR ABANDONMENTAND  PARKLANDS, PHASE IV - DESIGN AND CONSTRUCTION OF STORM WATER GI AT FOUR PARKLANDS SITESAND  POLLUTION SOLUTIONS, PHASE III - PROVIDE FOR THE PURCHASE AND INSTALLATION OR CONSTRUCTION OF PROTECTIVE STORM WATER MEASURES AT MUNICIPAL INDUSTRIAL SITESAND  GI RIGHT OF WAY RETROFITS (ROW), PHASE IV - DESIGN AND CONSTRUCTION OF VOLUNTARY, SMALL-SCALE GI STORM WATER CAPTURE PRACTICES AS SUPPLEMENTARY COMPONENTS OF ROW UPGRADES.

THIS GRANT WILL PROVIDE FUNDING TO THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA, DEPARTMENT OF ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENT (DC DOEE) FOR THE CONSTRUCTION OF CATEGORICALLY GREEN, NON-POINT SOURCE PROJECTS AS IDENTIFIED IN THE GRANT APPLICATION DATED JULY 8, 2020.

TO PROVIDE THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA WITH ON-SITE CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND OVERSIGHT SERVICES TO FULLY SUPPORT THE DISTRICT'S ENDEAVOR TO ACCOMPLISH CONSTRUCTION AND/OR IMPROVEMENTS OF ITS WASTE WATER FACILITIES AS AUTHORIZED IN THE APPROPRIATIONS ACT OF 1997. FEDERAL FUNDS OF $892,000 ARE CONTINGENT UPON AVAILABILITY.

THIS GRANT WILL PROVIDE FUNDING TO THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA, DEPARTMENT OF ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENT (DC DOEE) FOR THE CONSTRUCTION OF CATEGORICALLY GREEN, NON-POINT SOURCE PROJECTS AS IDENTIFIED IN THE GRANT APPLICATION DATED JULY 18, 2019.

THIS GRANT WILL PROVIDE FUNDING TO THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA, DEPARTMENT OF ENERGY AND THE ENVIRONMENT (DC DOEE) FOR THE CONSTRUCTION OF CATEGORICALLY GREEN, NON-POINT SOURCE PROJECTS AS IDENTIFIED IN THE GRANT APPLICATION DATED JUNE 4, 2018.

THIS GRANT WILL PROVIDE FUNDING TO THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA, DEPARTMENT OF ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENT (DC DOEE) TO SUPPORT ITS EFFORTS IN THE CONSTRUCTION OF WATER QUALITY PROJECTS AND MANAGEMENT ACTIVITIES TO PROTECT AND IMPROVE WATER QUALITY ON A WATERSHED BASIS.

DESCRIPTION:THIS INFRASTRUCTURE INVESTMENT AND JOBS ACT (COMMONLY REFERRED TO AS THE BIPARTISAN INFRASTRUCTURE LAW) FUNDED GRANT WILL PROVIDE FUNDING TO THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA, DEPARTMENT OF ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENT (DC DOEE) FOR THE CONSTRUCTION OF PROJECTS DESIGNED TO ADDRESS EMERGING CONTAMINANTS. EMERGING CONTAMINANTS REFER TO SUBSTANCES AND MICROORGANISMS, INCLUDING MANUFACTURED OR NATURALLY OCCURRING PHYSICAL, CHEMICAL, BIOLOGICAL, RADIOLOGICAL, OR NUCLEAR MATERIALS, WHICH ARE KNOWN OR ANTICIPATED IN THE ENVIRONMENT, THAT MAY POSE NEWLY IDENTIFIED OR RE-EMERGING RISKS TO HUMAN HEALTH, AQUATIC LIFE, OR THE ENVIRONMENT. THESE SUBSTANCES, MICROORGANISMS OR MATERIALS CAN INCLUDE MANY DIFFERENT TYPES OF NATURAL OR MANUFACTURED CHEMICALS AND SUBSTANCES - SUCH AS THOSE IN SOME COMPOUNDS OF PERSONAL CARE PRODUCTS, PHARMACEUTICALS, INDUSTRIAL CHEMICALS, PESTICIDES, AND MICROPLASTICS.ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE CONSTRUCTION PROJECTS YET TO BE DETERMINED WHICH WILL BE DESIGNED TO ADDRESS EMERGING CONTAMINANTS WITHIN THE DISTRICT. SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE BENEFITS OF THIS GRANT WILL BE TO DESIGN AND CONSTRUCT PROJECTS IN THE DISTRICT WITH A PRIMARY FOCUS ON EMERGING CONTAMINANTS. THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES ARE TO IMPROVE AND PROTECT WATER QUALITY AND PUBLIC HEALTH FOR CITIZENS THROUGHOUT THE DISTRICT.  THE BENEFICIARIES OF THE GRANT ARE THE CITIZENS OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA.

DESCRIPTION:THIS GRANT WILL PROVIDE FUNDING TO THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA, DEPARTMENT OF ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENT (DC DOEE), FOR THE CONSTRUCTION OF THREE CATEGORICALLY GREEN, NON-POINT SOURCE PROJECTS, AS IDENTIFIED IN THE GRANT APPLICATION DATED 8/2/2022, TO CONTROL STORM WATER RUNOFF AND PREVENT POLLUTION IN WATERWAYS.ACTIVITIES:PROJECTS TO BE FUNDED INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING:  FORT DUPONT STEAM AND WETLAND RESTORATION, PHASE 1 - FUND 50% OF THE PROJECT TO IMPROVE WATER QUALITY IN THE ANACOSTIA RIVER BY DECREASING SEDIMENT LOADS FROM 21,000 LINEAR FEET OF STREAMBANK; BROAD BRANCH AND SPRING WALLEY GREEN INFRASTRUCTURE RIGHT OF WAY RETROFITS, PHASE 2 - TO FUND FINAL DESIGNS FOR PLANNED RIGHT OF WAY (ROW) RETROFITS WITHIN TWO IMPAIRED SUBWATERSHEDS IN THE MS4 THAT WILL RETROFIT STREETS, ALLEYS, AND TRIANGLE PARKS WITH INFRASTRUCTURE TO CAPTURE AND TREAT AN ESTIMATED 200,000 GALLONS OF STORMWATER; DISTRICT CAPITAL BIKESHARE GREEN MOBILITY HUBS, PART A, PHASE 2 - TO FUND THE LOW IMPACT DEVELOPMENT (LID) CENTER'S WORK TO INCORPORATE STORMWATER BEST MANAGEMENT PRACTICES SUCH AS PERMEABLE PAVEMENTS, STRUCTURAL SOILS, AND BIORETENTION CELLS INTO FIVE CAPITAL BIKESHARE STATIONS WITHIN THE PUBLIC ROW.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:OUTCOMES EXPECTED INCLUDE REDUCED STORMWATER FLOW, REDUCED STORMWATER POLLUTION REACHING NEARBY RIVERS, AND DECREASED SEDIMENT LOADS IN NEARBY RIVERS. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE THE CITIZENS OF THE DISTRICT AND THOSE DOWNSTREAM OF THE DISTRICT.

DESCRIPTION:THIS INFRASTRUCTURE INVESTMENT AND JOBS ACT (COMMONLY REFERRED TO AS THE BIPARTISAN INFRASTRUCTURE LAW) FUNDED GRANT WILL PROVIDE FUNDING TO THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA, DEPARTMENT OF ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENT (DC DOEE) FOR THE CONSTRUCTION OF NINE CATEGORICALLY GREEN, NON-POINT SOURCE PROJECTS, AS IDENTIFIED IN THE GRANT APPLICATION DATED 8/2/2022, TO CONTROL STORM WATER RUNOFF AND PREVENT POLLUTION IN WATERWAYS.ACTIVITIES:PROJECTS TO BE FUNDED INCLUDE: DISTRICT STORMWATER OUTFALL RESTORATION, PART B, PHASE 1 - TO RECONSTRUCT FOUR DEGRADED STORMWATER OUTFALLS AND RESTORE 900 FEET OF THE STICKFOOT BRANCH TRIBUTARY; FORT DUPONT STREAM AND WETLAND RESTORATION, PHASE 1 - TO FUND 50% OF THE PROJECT'S CONSTRUCTION COSTS TO IMPROVE WATER QUALITY IN THE ANACOSTIA RIVER BY DECREASING SEDIMENT LOADS AND RESTORING 21,000 FEET OF STREAM BANK; FORT LINCOLN RETROFITS, PHASE 1 - TO RESTORE AND IMPROVE THREE LARGE STORMWATER PONDS THAT HAVE A SERIOUS IMPACT ON ADJACENT WETLANDS AND THE ANACOSTIA RIVER; PARKLAND LID RETROFITS, PART E, PHASE 1 - TO DESIGN AND CONSTRUCT GREEN INFRASTRUCTURE SUCH AS BIORETENTION OR PERMEABLE PAVEMENT ON THREE PARCELS TO CAPTURE A 1.2 INCH RAIN EVENT; RIVERSMART SCHOOLS, PART E, PHASE 1 - TO DESIGN AND CONSTRUCT GREEN INFRASTRUCTURE AT THREE SCHOOL YARDS INCLUDING IMPERVIOUS SURFACE REMOVAL, BIORETENTION, SWALES, PERMEABLE PAVERS, AND RAIN BARRELS; BROAD BRANCH AND SPRING VALLEY GREEN INFRASTRUCTURE RIGHT OF WAY RETROFITS, PHASE 2 - TO FUND FINAL DESIGNS FOR THE PLANNED ROW RETROFITS WITHIN TWO IMPAIRED SUBWATERSHEDS; CITYWIDE LOW IMPACT DEVELOPMENT DEMONSTRATIONS WITHIN THE RIGHT OF WAY, PHASE 2 - TO FUND A DEMONSTRATION PROCESS FOR DDOT FOR EIGHT SITES THAT WILL SHOW STORMWATER REDUCTION METHODS THAT CAN BE USED ELSEWHERE IN THE CITY; GREEN INFRASTRUCTURE RIGHT OF WAY RETROFITS, PART B, PHASE 1 - TO FUND DDOT'S WORK TO RETROFIT ROADS AND SIDEWALKS WITH STORMWATER GREEN INFRASTRUCTURE TO REDUCE THE IMPACT OF STORMWATER RUNOFF FROM UPSTREAM AREAS; AND MULTIPLE PURPOSE GREEN INFRASTRUCTURE, PHASE 3 - TO FUND DDOT'S WORK TO INCORPORATE GREEN INFRASTRUCTURE INTO 30 EXISTING ROADWAY IMPROVEMENT SITES WHERE DDOT'S GOAL IS FOR TRAFFIC CALMING, TRAFFIC RESTRICTION MEASURES, OR INTERSECTION REALIGNMENTS AND THESE MODIFICATIONS WILL INCLUDE GREEN INFRASTRUCTURE TO REDUCE STORMWATER RUNOFF.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:OUTCOMES EXPECTED INCLUDE REDUCED STORMWATER FLOW, REDUCED STORMWATER POLLUTION REACHING NEARBY RIVERS, AND DECREASED SEDIMENT LOADS IN NEARBY RIVERS. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE THE CITIZENS OF THE DISTRICT AND THOSE DOWNSTREAM OF THE DISTRICT.
OVER FIVE YEARS, ELI WILL CONVENE THREE MULTI-DAY NATIONAL TRAINING WORKSHOPS (IN ODD YEARS), AS WELL AS TWO HALF-DAY SEMINARS AND TWO HALF-DAY WEBIN

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS AGREEMENT IS TO PROVIDE FUNDS TO THE VIRGIN ISLANDS DEPARTMENT OF PLANNING AND NATURAL RESOURCES FOR CLEAN WATER INFRASTRUCTURE ACTIVITIES AND PROJECTS.  THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES ARE TO ESTABLISH AND MANAGE AN EFFECTIVE COMPREHENSIVE WATER POLLUTION CONTROL PROGRAM  TO IMPROVE AND PROTECT WATER QUALITY AND PUBLIC HEALTH OF US VIRGIN ISLANDS.  ACTIVITIES:ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE REPAIRS, REPLACEMENT, REHABILITATION AND UPGRADES TO SEWER INTERCEPTORS, FORCE MAINS AND PUMP STATIONS IN THE UNITED STATES VIRGIN ISLANDS.  SUBRECIPIENT:ACTIVITIES/PROJECTS TO BE IMPLEMENTED VIA SUBAWARD ARE BASED ON THE TERRITORY'S PPL AND INTENDED USE PLAN FOR THE CONSTRUCTION OF PUBLIC WASTEWATER TREATMENT PROJECTS. THESE PROJECTS, WHICH CONSTITUTE A SIGNIFICANT CONTRIBUTION TO THE NATION'S WATER INFRASTRUCTURE, INCLUDE SEWAGE TREATMENT PLANTS, PUMPING STATIONS, COLLECTION AND INTERCEPT SEWERS, REHABILITATION OF SEWAGE SYSTEMS, AND THE STORM WATER SYSTEMS.OUTCOMES:THIS GRANT WILL FUND STORMWATER/SEWER RELATED INFRASTRUCTURE PROJECTS IN THE TERRITORY. THE PROJECTS TO BE FUNDED UNDER THIS GRANT ARE SELECTED AND PRIORITIZED IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE TERRITORY'S PROJECT PRIORITY LIST (PPL),  THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES OF THE GRANT ARE THE CITIZENS OF THE US VIRGIN ISLANDS.

THIS GRANT PROVIDES FUNDS TO THE VIRGIN ISLANDS DEPARTMENT OF PLANNING AND NATURAL RESOURCES FOR IMPLEMENTATION OF REPAIRS, REPLACEMENT, REHABILITATION AND UPGRADES TO SEWER INTERCEPTORS, FORCE MAINS AND  PUMP STATIONS IN THE UNITED STATES VIRGIN ISLANDS. THIS PROJECT WILL ALSO FUND STORMWATER/SEWER RELATED  PROJECTS IN THE TERRITORY.  THE PROJECTS TO BE FUNDED UNDER THIS GRANT ARE SELECTED AND PRIORITIZED IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE TERRITORY'S PROJECT PRIORITY LIST (PPL).

THIS GRANT PROVIDES FUNDS TO THE VIRGIN ISLANDS DEPARTMENT OF PLANNING AND NATURAL RESOURCES FOR IMPLEMENTATION OF REPAIRS, REPLACEMENT, REHABILITATION AND UPGRADES TO SEWER INTERCEPTORS, FORCE MAINS AND  PUMP STATIONS IN THE UNITED STATES VIRGIN ISLANDS. THIS PROJECT WILL ALSO FUND STORMWATER/SEWER RELATED  PROJECTS IN THE TERRITORY.  THE PROJECTS TO BE FUNDED UNDER THIS GRANT WERE SELECTED BASED ON  INTENDED USE PLAN (IUP) AND PRIORITIZED IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE TERRITORY'S PROJECT PRIORITY LIST

THIS GRANT PROVIDES FUNDS TO THE VIRGIN ISLANDS DEPARTMENT OF PLANNING AND NATURAL RESOURCES FOR IMPLEMENTATION OF REPAIRS, REPLACEMENT, REHABILITATION AND UPGRADES TO SEWER INTERCEPTORS, FORCE MAINS AND  PUMP STATIONS IN THE UNITED STATES VIRGIN ISLANDS. THIS PROJECT WILL ALSO FUND STORMWATER/SEWER RELATED  PROJECTS IN THE TERRITORY.  THE PROJECTS TO BE FUNDED UNDER THIS GRANT WERE SELECTED BASED ON AN  INTENDED USE PLAN AND PRIORITIZED IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE TERRITORY'S PROJECT PRIORITY LIST.

THIS GRANT PROVIDES FUNDS TO THE VIRGIN ISLANDS DEPARTMENT OF PLANNING AND NATURAL RESOURCES FOR IMPLEMENTATION OF REPAIRS, REPLACEMENT, REHABILITATION AND UPGRADES TO SEWER INTERCEPTORS, FORCE MAINS AND PUMP STATIONS IN THE UNITED STATES VIRGIN ISLANDS. THIS PROJECT WILL ALSO FUND STORMWATER/SEWER RELATED  PROJECTS IN THE TERRITORY. THE PROJECTS TO BE FUNDED UNDER THIS GRANT WERE SELECTED BASED ON THE INTENDED USE PLAN, PUBLISHED ON JULY 9, 2018 AND PRIORITIZED IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE TERRITORY'S PROJECT PRIORITY LIST.
THIS PROJECT WILL CONTINUE THE IMPLEMENTATION OF THE REPAIRS, REPLACEMENT, REHABILITATION AND UPGRADES TO SEWER INTERCEPTORS FORCE MAINS AND  PUMP ST
THIS PROJECT WILL CONTINUE THE IMPLEMENTATION OF THE REPAIRS, REPLACEMENT, REHABILITATION AND UPGRADES TO SEWER INTERCEPTORS FORCE MAINS AND  PUMP ST
THE PROJECT WILL ADDRESS THE REPAIRS, REPLACEMENT, REHABILITATION, AND UPGRADES TO PUMP STATIONS, FORCE MAIN, AND SEWER INTERCEPTORS AS RECOMMENDED I

THIS PROJECT IS FOR THE CONTINUATION OF CONSTRUCTION OF NECESSARY REPAIR, REPLACEMENT AND/OR REHABILITATION WORK AS RECOMMENDED IN THE FINAL INSPECT

DESCRIPTION:THIS GRANT WILL PROVIDE FUNDING TO REHABILITATE AND STRUCTURALLY STRENGTHEN SEVERAL DETERIORATING COMBINED SEWER SEGMENTS OF VARIOUS SIZES IN THE PINEY BRANCH SEWERSHED WITH THE USE OF TRENCHLESS REHABILITATION TECHNOLOGIES AND METHODS. THE PINEY BRANCH SEWERSHED IS LOCATED WITHIN THE UPPER NORTHWEST SECTION OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA. THE SCOPE AND ENVIRONMENTAL EFFECTS OF THE PROPOSED PROJECT WERE IDENTIFIED IN CATEGORICAL EXCLUSION DECISION CE-DC-1-2022 ISSUED AUGUST 16, 2022.

ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES TO BE CONDUCTED UNDER THE PROPOSED PROJECT WERE IDENTIFIED IN CATEGORICAL EXCLUSION DECISION CE-DC-1-2022 ISSUED AUGUST 16, 2022, AND INCLUDE: STRUCTURAL REHABILITATION USING GEOPOLYMER LINING SYSTEM (GLS) ON APPROXIMATELY THIRTEEN THOUSAND EIGHT HUNDRED (13,800) LINEAR FEET OF COMBINED SEWER PIPES OF VARIOUS SIZES AND SHAPES WITH ASSOCIATED INTERNAL POINT REPAIRS AND LATERAL PIPE REINSTATEMENTS; TWO (2) OPEN CUT POINT REPAIRS; TWO (2) INTERNAL POINT REPAIRS ON 90-INCH DIAMETER SEWERS; STRUCTURAL REHABILITATION USING GEOPOLYMER LINING SYSTEM (GLS) ON FIVE (5) JUNCTION CHAMBERS; REHABILITATION OF SEVENTY-TWO (72) EXISTING MANHOLES WITH VARIOUS REHABILITATION METHODS, INCLUDING GEOPOLYMER LINING SYSTEM, STEP REPLACEMENT, GRADE RING REPLACEMENT, AND FRAME AND COVER REPLACEMENT; CONSTRUCTION OF THREE (3) NEW MANHOLES; ABANDONMENT OF APPROXIMATELY FOUR HUNDRED (400) LINEAR FEET OF 36- INCH TO 51-INCH DIAMETER PIPELINES AND ONE (1) JUNCTION CHAMBER AT SHERMAN CIRCLE NW WITHIN NATIONAL PARK SERVICE (NPS) PROPERTY; AND, SEWER BYPASS PUMPING, DEWATERING, EROSION AND SEDIMENT CONTROL, TRAFFIC CONTROL, AND RESTORATION OF PROJECT SITE. 
SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THIS PROJECT WILL RESTORE THE FUNCTION OF AN INTEGRAL PART OF THE SEWAGE CONVEYANCE SYSTEM IN THE PINEY BRANCH SECTION OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA AND WILL INCREASE THE RELIABILITY OF THE SYSTEM TO CONVEY AND TRANSPORT SEWAGE ACROSS THE CITY TO BE ADEQUATELY TREATED AT THE BLUE PLAINS WASTEWATER TREATMENT PLANT. THE BENEFICIARIES ARE THE RESIDENTS OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA.

THIS GRANT WILL PROVIDE FUNDING FOR IMPROVEMENTS TO THE 'PRIMARY SLUDGE SCREENING AND DEGRITTING BUILDING' AND THE TEN EXISTING GRAVITY THICKENERS AT THE BLUE PLAINS ADVANCED WASTEWATER TREATMENT PLANT IN WASHINGTON, DC AS DESCRIBED IN CATEGORICAL EXCLUSION DECISION NUMBER CE-DC-2-2017 AND ISSUED ON AUGUST 16, 2017.
THIS GRANT WILL PROVIDE FUNDING FOR THE NEW "FILTRATE TREATMENT FACILITY" AT THE BLUE PLAINS ADVANCED WASTEWATER TREATMENT PLANT IN WASHINGTON, DC AS
THIS GRANT WILL PROVIDE FUNDING FOR STRUCTURAL, MECHANICAL, AND ELECTRICAL IMPROVEMENTS TO THE EXISTING SECONDARY REACTORS, EAST SECONDARY SEDIMENTAT
